intro: Metrosideros regelii, commonly known as the New Zealand flame tree, is a species of flowering plant in the Myrtaceae family. It is native to New Zealand and is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has small, elliptical leaves that are usually covered in a fine, white powdery coating. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often growing as a small tree or shrub. The flowers attract a variety of pollinators, including birds and insects, making it an important component of local ecosystems.
